issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: [Umbrella] RM Restart Phase 1: State storage and non-work-preserving recovery

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Secure RM with recovery enabled and rm state store on hdfs fails with gss exception

comments.body:

java.io.IOException: Failed on local exception: java.io.IOException: javax.security.sasl.S
{code}
It looks like we try to interact with hdfs before the rm has logged in using the keytab.

Yes, specifically, we should create the state store base directories after doSecureLogin() inside ResourceManaager.serviceStart() has been called.
So propose to augment RMStateStore to extend service model, where creating base dirs can be performed inside serviceStart().
Taking this over for a quick fix.

Patch moving state-store file-system handle creation to start.

Made the state-store extend AbstractService as per Jian's suggestion above, which I like too - the life-cycle for state-store is too adhoc as of now as evidenced by test-code.

Added a simple one line verification test which validates that fs is null before start and non-null after the start.
